original_title: More than 2,000 National Guard troops deployed to Washington for crime mission | Fox News
article_summary: Six states have pledged to send National Guard troops to Washington D.C. to aid President Trump's crime crackdown, with over 2,000 troops expected to participate. Ohio, West Virginia, South Carolina, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Tennessee are among the states contributing troops, with approximately 500 West Virginia National Guard soldiers already in Washington. The troops are being deployed to protect federal assets, provide a safe environment for law enforcement, and deter crime.</s>
